title: 114_s1634
content: The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2015 may be cited as the "Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act." This Act allows for injunctions against railroad common carriers. Section 16 of the Clayton Act (15 U.S.C. 26) is amended to allow for injunctions against railroad common carriers, with specific provisions outlined for preliminary injunctions and a savings provision to limit who can bring suit for injunctive relief. The Clayton Act is amended to allow injunctions against railroad common carriers under specific provisions, including costs and attorney's fees in any action. SEC. 3. MERGERS AND ACQUISITIONS OF RAILROADS. Section 7 of the Clayton Act (15 U.S.C. 18) is amended to clarify prohibitions on certain actions by individuals. The Clayton Act (15 U.S.C. 18) is amended to clarify prohibitions on certain actions by individuals. Nothing in this section shall apply to transactions duly consummated pursuant to authority given by specified government agencies. The Clayton Act is amended to clarify prohibitions on certain actions by individuals, excluding transactions authorized by government agencies. The Clayton Act is amended to limit the primary jurisdiction of the Surface Transportation Board in civil actions against common carrier railroads. Additionally, the Federal Trade Commission is granted enforcement powers. SEC. 5 amends the Clayton Act and grants enforcement powers to the Federal Trade Commission. SEC. 6 expands treble damages to rail common carriers. SEC. 6 expands treble damages to rail common carriers under the Clayton Act. Section 10706 of title 49, United States Code, is amended to remove references to the Sherman Act and antitrust laws in agreements made by parties. Section 10706 of title 49, United States Code, is amended to remove references to the Sherman Act and antitrust laws in agreements made by parties. This section clarifies that proposed agreements are not exempt from antitrust laws and the Board must consider the impact on shippers, consumers, and affected communities when reviewing such agreements. The Clayton Act is amended to clarify exemptions from antitrust laws, stating that transactions described in the act are not exempt from the Sherman Act, Clayton Act, Federal Trade Commission Act, Wilson Tariff Act, or the Act of June 19, 1936. The exemption does not apply to transactions related to the pooling of railroad cars approved by the Surface Transportation Board. The Surface Transportation Board or its predecessor agency approves the pooling of railroad cars. The Board considers the impact on shippers and affected communities in reviewing such transactions. Chapter 107 of title 49, United States Code, is amended to reflect these changes. Section 10706 is amended to include rate agreements, with the section heading changed to "Rate agreements". The effective date of this amendment is specified in Section 8. The Act will take effect on the date of its enactment, with conditions prohibiting civil actions for conduct before enactment and establishing a 180-day grace period for filing complaints.
